channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Italy set to regain its spot as world’s largest wine producer—overtaking France
item.description: Due to unfavorable weather affecting French vineyards, Italy is poised to surpass France as the world's largest wine producer this year.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Markets have finally processed the good news
item.description: “Twenty-four little hours / Brought the sun and the flowers / Where there used to be rain,” sings Dinah Washington. She could've been singing about ma...

item.title: Traders brace for volatility with $5 trillion 'triple witching' options expiry
Beds sold at Amazon, Walmart recalled due to collapse hazard
item.description: The recall covers a discontinued version of its platform beds, which the company says were manufactured between 2019 and 2021.

item.title: Britain's ultra-wealthy are threatening to exit en masse ahead of proposed tax changes
item.description: Labour's plans to axe the U.K.'s non-dom tax regime could spark an ultra wealthy exodus, advisers and research bodies have warned.

item.title: Mortgage rates went up right after the Fed cut interest rates. Here’s why.
Gen Z needs more than a paycheck at work—here’s how I deliver as CEO
item.description: Rather than resisting Gen Z’s instinct to carve their own career paths and seek purpose-driven work, leaders can nurture it.

item.title: Companies face risk of huge fines and suspensions under tough new cyber rules in the EU
item.description: Companies could face hefty fines or even suspensions of service in the EU under strict new cybersecurity regulations set to come into force next month...

item.title: Nike taps company veteran as new CEO, and shares rally
Nike welcomes new CEO with $27 million payday
item.description: Veteran executive Elliott Hill retired from the retailer in 2020—and he’s back.

item.title: Bank of Japan keeps key interest rate steady as it treads cautiously on normalizing policy
item.description: The decision came as the central bank seeks to wean its economy off the long-held ultra-easy monetary policy and curb the yen's slide against the U.S....

item.title: Dow surges to record as investors celebrate Fed’s ‘recalibration’ rate cut
America ranks worst in the world for health care—despite spending trillions
item.description: The U.S. came in last in three of five categories—equity, health outcomes, and access to care—in addition to having the poorest overall ranking.

item.title: Disney to ditch Slack after July data breach
item.description: The company's Slack server was hacked in July, leading to more than a terabyte of company data being leaked to the public.

item.title: Dow tops 42,000 for first time ever, sets record close after Fed’s big rate cut
